Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a prospective cohort study from 2009 to 2011

Participants.evidence: 11 patients with juxtaarticular osteosarcoma of the proximal tibia (mean age, 12 years; range, 9–16 years) were included. Eligibility criteria were a tumor edge to articular surface distance of 10 to 15 mm, good chemotherapy response, absence of pathologic fracture, and no major neurovascular involvement.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved transepiphysis tumor resection with navigation-assisted microwave ablation, followed by reconstruction using allograft and a vascularized fibula flap.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the effectiveness of joint-preserving tumor resection for juxtaarticular osteosarcoma after microwave ablation of the tumor edge under navigation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was local tumor control, assessed over the follow-up period.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 11 patients with juxtaarticular osteosarcoma of the proximal tibia (mean age, 12 years; range, 9–16 years) were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No local recurrences were observed. Functional outcomes, measured by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society score, ranged from 26 to 30, with a mean of 29.

Harms.evidence: Major complications included osteonecrosis of part of the epiphysis in two patients and deep infection in one.
